RefParameter.Name: LwIP Version
RefParameter.Comment: LwIP Version (Version of LwIP supported by CubeMX ** CubeMX specific **)
RefParameter.Description:
LwIP version supported by CubeMX is the Official Release 2.1.2.
MQTT and HOOK configuration is not supported via CubeMx GUI.
LwIP stack has an internal parameter defined in init.h providing its version: LWIP_VERSION.
Here, the LwIP Version is just displayed to highlight the LwIP version supported by CubeMX.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX and is not configurable, LWIP_VERSION being already defined in init.h.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP requires both LWIP_UDP and LWIP_IPV4 enabled.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) module is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) module is enabled.
Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP requires both LWIP_UDP and LWIP_IPV4 enabled.

RefParameter.Name: ETH_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Ethernet Rx buffer size

RefParameter.Name: ETH_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Ethernet Rx buffer size

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: If DHCP is disabled, the IP address is mandatory.
Dependency: If DHCP is disabled, the Netmask address is mandatory.
Dependency: If DHCP is disabled, the Gateway address is mandatory.

RefParameter.Name: WITH_RTOS

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: WITH_RTOS is enabled means NO_SYS is enabled (set to 0) and FREERTOS is enabled.

RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is enabled as soon as FREERTOS is enabled in MiddleWares tree.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.

RefParameter.Name: WITH_RTOS
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is disabled as soon as FREERTOS is disabled in MiddleWares tree.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.
Dependency: WITH_RTOS is disabled means NO_SYS is disabled (set to 1) and FREERTOS is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: WITH_MBEDTLS

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: WITH_MBEDTLS is enabled means FREERTOS and MBEDTLS are both enabled, and LWIP_USE_EXTERNAL_MBEDTLS is forced to Enabled in Key Options/PolarSSL Options.
Limitation: LwIP with MBEDTLS but without FREERTOS is not yet supported by CubeMX.

RefParameter.Description:
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.
This parameter is enabled as soon as MBEDTLS and FREERTOS are enabled in MiddleWares tree.
Consequently:
- MX_LWIP_Init() function is generated within mbedtls_net_init() function in net_cockets.c file
- Up to user to call mbedtls_net_init() function in MBEDTLS initialization step
- LWIP_DNS value is forced to Enabled
- LWIP_UDP value is forced to Enabled
- LWIP_USE_EXTERNAL_MBEDTLS value is forced to Enabled
- LWIP_INCLUDED_POLARSSL_ARC4 value is forced to Disabled (excluding arc4.c/arc4.h files from lwip stack)
- LWIP_INCLUDED_POLARSSL_DES value is forced to Disabled (excluding des.c/des.h files from lwip stack)
- LWIP_INCLUDED_POLARSSL_MD4 is forced to Disabled (excluding md4.c/md4.h files from lwip stack)
- LWIP_INCLUDED_POLARSSL_MD5 is forced to Disabled (excluding md5.c/md5.h files from lwip stack)
- LWIP_INCLUDED_POLARSSL_SHA1 is forced to Disabled (excluding sha1.c/sha1.h files from lwip stack)
- ecp.c/ecp.h ppp files are excluded from lwip stack also.

RefParameter.Name: WITH_MBEDTLS
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is enabled as soon as MBEDTLS is enabled in MiddleWares tree.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.

RefParameter.Name: CMSIS_VERSION

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: This parameter is linked to FREERTOS API CMSIS version parameter.

RefParameter.Description: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX and gives CMSIS version used.

RefParameter.Name: CMSIS_VERSION

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: This parameter is linked to FREERTOS API CMSIS version parameter.

RefParameter.Description: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX and gives CMSIS version used.

RefParameter.Name: RTOS_USE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: This parameter is linked to FREERTOS API CMSIS version parameter.

RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is enabled as soon as FREERTOS is enabled in MiddleWares tree.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.

RefParameter.Name: RTOS_USE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter is enabled as soon as FREERTOS is enabled in MiddleWares tree.
Warning: This parameter has been introduced by CubeMX.

RefParameter.Name: PHY Driver
RefParameter.Description:
Platform Settings PHY Driver must be configured from the LwIP 'Platform Settings' top right tab.
PHY Driver can be set either to Choose or to LAN8742:
- Choose: BSP PHY Driver components provided by ST are not used and up to user to implement his own driver with same architecture and constraints than LAN8742 ; ST specification will be published soon to explain how user can develop his own BSP driver component.
- LAN8742: LAN8742 BSP PHY Driver component is used and STM32CubeMX copies lan8742.c/.h files from ST Firmware Package to the user's project Drivers/BSP/Components directory.
Note: BSP components files cannot be updated or they will be overwritten at each project generation.

RefParameter.Name: PHY Driver
RefParameter.Description:
Platform Settings PHY Driver must be configured from the LwIP 'Platform Settings' top right tab.
PHY Driver can be set either to Choose or to LAN8742:
- Choose: BSP PHY Driver components provided by ST are not used and up to user to implement his own driver with same architecture and constraints than LAN8742 ; ST specification will be published soon to explain how user can develop his own BSP driver component.
- LAN8742: LAN8742 BSP PHY Driver component is used and STM32CubeMX copies lan8742.c/.h files from ST Firmware Package to the user's project Drivers/BSP/Components directory.
Note: BSP components files cannot be updated or they will be overwritten at each project generation.

RefParameter.Name: PHY Driver
RefParameter.Description:
Platform Settings must be configured from 'Platform Settings' LwIP top right tab.
Choose: BSP PHY Driver components provided by ST are not used.
LAN8742: LAN8742 BSP PHY Driver component from ST Firmware Package is used.
Note: LAN8742 files are located in project location within Drivers\BSP\Components folder. These BSP components files cannot be updated or they will be overwritten at each project generation.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ICMP
RefParameter.Description:
This option enables ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) module inside the IP stack.Be careful, disable that make your product non-compliant to RFC1122.
- "Debug" tab.
Dependency: None.
Note: For more options on ICMP, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "ICMP/IGMP Options"
- "Statistics" tab
- "Checksum" tab

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_IGMP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: When MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled, use LWIP_IGMP requires LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS enabled and also MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP>1.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on IGMP (Internet Group Management Protocol) module.
LWIP_RAND() is in cc.h (in \system\arch).
Note: For more options on IGMP, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "ICMP/IGMP", "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" and "LOOPIF" Options
- "Statistics" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_IGMP
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on IGMP (Internet Group Management Protocol) module.
LWIP_RAND() is in cc.h (in \system\arch).
Dependency: When MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled, use LWIP_IGMP requires LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS enabled and also MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP>1.
Note: For more options on IGMP, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "ICMP/IGMP", "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" and "LOOPIF" Options
- "Statistics" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on DNS (Domain Name Server) module. UDP must be available for DNS transport.
Note: For more options on DNS, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "DNS" and "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" Options
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: LWIP_DNS is enabled when MBEDTLS is enabled. Use LWIP_DNS requires LWIP_UDP enabled.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on DNS (Domain Name Server) module. UDP must be available for DNS transport.
Note: For more options on DNS, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "DNS" and "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" Options
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on DNS (Domain Name Server) module. UDP must be available for DNS transport.
Dependency: LWIP_DNS is enabled when MBEDTLS is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_UDP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_UDP requires MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on UDP (User Datagram Protocol).
Note: For more options on UDP, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "UDP", "IP" and "Thread" Options
- "Statistics" tab
- "Checksum" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_UDP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: LWIP_UDP is enabled when MBEDTLS is enabled. Use LWIP_UDP requires MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is disabled, it turns off UDP (User Datagram Protocol).
Note: For more options on UDP, please check in:
- "Key Options" tab within "UDP", "IP" and "Thread" Options
- "Statistics" tab
- "Checksum" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_UDP
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter turns on UDP (User Datagram Protocol).
Dependency: LWIP_UDP is enabled when MBEDTLS is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB
RefParameter.Description:
Number of UDP protocol control blocks. One per active UDP connection (requires the LWIP_UDP option enabled).
Dependency: Use MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB requires MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled and LWIP_UDP enabled, it is mandatory to have MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB>0.
Note: For more memory options, see in "Key Options" tab within "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" Options.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: If you want to use TCP:
- you have to define MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB>=1 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled
- TCP_SND_QUEUELEN must fit in an u16_t and must be greater than 1
- If LWIP_WND_SCALE is enabled, TCP_WND and must fit in an u32_t and must be greater than 1
- If LWIP_WND_SCALE is disabled, TCP_WND and must fit in an u16_t and must be greater than 1
- TCP_MAXRTX and TCP_SYNMAXRTX must be less or equal to 12.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on TCP.
Note: For more TCP options, see in:
- "Key Options" tab within "TCP", "IP", "Internal Memory Pool Sizes", "Thread" and "Sequential Layer" Options
- "Perf/Checks" tab
- "Statistics" tab
- "Checksum" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on TCP.
Dependency: If you want to use TCP:
- you have to define MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB>=1 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled
- TCP_SND_QUEUELEN must fit in an u16_t and must be greater than 1
- If LWIP_WND_SCALE is enabled, TCP_WND and must fit in an u32_t and must be greater than 1
- If LWIP_WND_SCALE is disabled, TCP_WND and must fit in an u16_t and must be greater than 1
- TCP_MAXRTX and TCP_SYNMAXRTX must be less or equal to 12.
Note: For more TCP options, see in:
- "Key Options" tab within "TCP", "IP", "Internal Memory Pool Sizes", "Thread" and "Sequential Layer" Options
- "Perf/Checks" tab
- "Statistics" tab
- "Checksum" tab
- "Debug" tab.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB
RefParameter.Description:
Number of simultatenously active TCP connections (requires the LWIP_TCP option enabled).
Dependency: Use MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB requires MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled and LWIP_TCP enabled, it is mandatory to have MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB>0.
Note: For more memory options, see in "Key Options" tab within "Internal Memory Pool Sizes" Options.

RefParameter.Name: PHY
RefParameter.Description: PHY MII parameter.

RefParameter.Name: PHY
RefParameter.Description: PHY RMII parameter.

RefParameter.Name: TX_DESCRIPTOR_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: First Tx Descriptor Address.

RefParameter.Name: TX_DESCRIPTOR_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: First Tx Descriptor Address.

RefParameter.Name: RX_DESCRIPTOR_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: First Rx Descriptor Address.

RefParameter.Name: RX_DESCRIPTOR_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: First Rx Descriptor Address.

RefParameter.Name: RX_BUFFER_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: Rx Buffer Address.

RefParameter.Name: RX_BUFFER_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: Rx Buffer Address.

RefParameter.Name: NO_SYS

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Forced to Enabled (set to 0) by activating FREERTOS middleware. To set NO_SYS to 1 (Disabled), unset FREERTOS middleware.

RefParameter.Description:
When NO_SYS=0, lwIP is used with selected Operating System (FreeRTOS) and its related thread, semaphores, mutexes or mboxes. This means threaded APIs are used (socket, netconn, i.e. everything in the 'api' folder).
Warning: Take care about NO_SYS value: NO_SYS(OS Used)=0.

RefParameter.Name: NO_SYS
RefParameter.Description:
When NO_SYS=1, lwIP is used without Operating System (no thread, semaphores, mutexes or mboxes). This means threaded APIs cannot be used (socket, netconn, i.e. everything in the 'api' folder), only the callback-style raw API is available (and you have to watch out for yourself that you don't access lwIP functions/structures from more than one context at a time!).
Warning: Take care about NO_SYS value: NO_SYS(OS Not Used)=1.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TIMERS
RefParameter.Description: Enable this parameter to use support for sys_timeout and lwip-internal cyclic timers (the array of lwip-internal cyclic timers is still provided, check NO_SYS_NO_TIMERS for compatibility to old versions).

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TIMERS_CUSTOM
RefParameter.Description:
Enable this parameter to provide your own timer implementation.
Function prototypes in timeouts.h and the array of lwip-internal cyclic timers are still included, but the implementation is not. The following functions will be required: sys_timeouts_init(), sys_timeout(), sys_untimeout(), sys_timeouts_mbox_fetch().

RefParameter.Name: MEMCPY(dst,src,len)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter allows to replace the default implementation included in C library by a faster user function.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: SMEMCPY(dst,src,len)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter allows to replace the default implementation by a user hand made. Some compilers (e.g. gcc) can inline a call to memcpy() if the length is known at compile time and is small.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMMOVE(dst,src,len)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter allows to replace the default implementation by a user hand made. Override this if you have a faster implementation at hand than the one included in your C library. lwIP currently uses MEMMOVE only when IPv6 fragmentation support is enabled.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_MPU_COMPATIBLE
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter allows to enable special memory management mechanism which makes lwip able to work on MPU (Memory Protection Unit) system by not passing stack-pointers to other threads
(this decreases performance as memory is allocated from pools instead of keeping it on the stack).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options
RefParameter.Description:
Enable this option to create a global mutex that is held during TCPIP thread operations.
It can be locked by client code to perform lwIP operations without changing into TCPIP thread using callbacks. See LOCK_TCPIP_CORE() and UNLOCK_TCPIP_CORE().
Your system should provide mutexes supporting priority inversion to use this.
Dependency: When using LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT, LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING must be enabled, too.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options
RefParameter.Description:
When LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING is enabled, this lets tcpip_input() grab the mutex for input packets as well, instead of allocating a message and passing it to tcpip_thread.
Warning: this does not work when tcpip_input() is called from interrupt context!

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options
RefParameter.Description:
When LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING is enabled, this lets tcpip_input() grab the mutex for input packets as well, instead of allocating a message and passing it to tcpip_thread.
Warning: this does not work when tcpip_input() is called from interrupt context!
Dependency: Use LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT requires LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING.

RefParameter.Name: SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT is used for inter task protection which works with an RTOS only when NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Description:
Enable this option if you want inter-task protection (and task-vs-interrupt protection) for certain critical regions during buffer allocation, deallocation and memory allocation and deallocation.
Warning: This is required when using lwIP from more than one context! If you disable this, you must be sure what you are doing!

RefParameter.Name: SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Core Locking and MPU Options
RefParameter.Description:
This option can be enabled only when NO_SYS=0, if you want inter-task protection (and task-vs-interrupt protection) for certain critical regions during buffer allocation, deallocation and memory allocation and deallocation.
Warning: This is required when using lwIP from more than one context! If you disable this, you must be sure what you are doing!
Dependency: This parameter is disable without RTOS (when NO_SYS=1)

RefParameter.Name: MEM_LIBC_MALLOC
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
This option can be set with:
- Enable: use malloc/free/realloc provided by your C-library instead of the lwip internal allocator. Can save code size if you already use it.
- Disable: use LwIP internal allocator library
Dependency: If MEM_LIBC_MALLOC=1, MEMP_USE_POOLS cannot be enabled. MEM_STATS value setting depends on MEM_LIBC_MALLOC value.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
This option is set as followed:
- Enabled: Use User C Pool Alloctor Functions i.e mem_malloc/mem_free instead of the lwip pool allocator, especially useful with MEM_LIBC_MALLOC but handle with care regarding execution speed (heap alloc can be much slower than pool alloc) and usage from interrupts (especially if your netif driver allocates PBUF_POOL pbufs for received frames from interrupt!)
- Disabled: Use LwIP Internal Pool Allocator Memory Functions.
Warning: Currently, this uses the heap for ALL pools (also for private pools, not only for internal pools defined in memp_std.h)!
Dependency: There are several other parameters linked to this one:
MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB, MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB, MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB, MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG, MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA, MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP, MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT, MEMP_NUM_NETCONN, MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_API, ARP_QUEUEING, IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS, LWIP_RAW, LWIP_IGMP, LWIP_UDP, LWIP_TCP, TCP_WND, TCP_SND_QUEUELEN, LWIP_NETCONN, LWIP_SOCKET.
Dependency:MEMP_MEM_MALLOC and MEM_USE_POOLS may not both be simultaneously enabled

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_MEM_INIT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter should be set to force use of memset to initialize pool memory.
Useful if pool are moved in uninitialized section of memory.
This will ensure default values in pcbs struct are well initialized in all conditions.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_ALIGNMENT
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter should be set to the alignment of the CPU: 4 byte alignment or 2 byte alignment.
Dependency: PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE must be greater than MEM_ALIGNMENT.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_SIZE
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
Size of the heap memory. If the application will send a lot of data that needs to be copied, this should be set high.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
The memp overflow protection parameter reserves a configurable amount of bytes before and after each memp element in every pool and fills it with a prominent default value:
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK=0: no checking
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK=1: checks each element when it is freed
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK>1: checks each element in every pool every time memp_malloc() or memp_free() is called (useful but slow!).

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_SANITY_CHECK
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
If this option is enabled, sanity check is run after each memp_free() to make sure that there are no cycles in the linked lists.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_OVERFLOW_CHECK
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
The mem overflow protection parameter reserves a configurable amount of bytes before and after each heap allocation chunk and fills it with a prominent default value.
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK=0: no checking
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK=1: checks each element when it is freed
- MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK>1: checks each element in every pool every time.
The function mem_malloc() or mem_free() is called (useful but slow!).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_SANITY_CHECK
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
If this option is enabled, sanity check is run after each mem_free() to make sure that the linked list of heap elements is not corrupted.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_USE_POOLS
RefParameter.Comment: MEM_USE_POOLS (Use an Alternative to malloc Function)
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options

Condition.Diagnostic:
Warning: If you enable both MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS and MEM_USE_POOLS, you must have lwippools.h in your include path somewhere and you must define your pools within lwippools.h.
Dependency: Use MEM_USE_POOLS requires MEM_LIBC_MALLOC and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled and MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS=1

RefParameter.Description: If this option is enabled, an alternative to malloc() is used by allocating from a set of memory pools of various sizes. When mem_malloc is called, an element of the smallest pool that can provide the length needed is returned. To use this, MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS also has to be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEM_USE_POOLS
RefParameter.Comment: MEM_USE_POOLS (Use an Alternative to malloc Function)
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
This option is disabled when MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS is disabled, to enable it enable MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS first.
When MEM_USE_POOLS is enabled, an alternative to malloc() is used by allocating from a set of memory pools of various sizes. When mem_malloc is called, an element of the smallest pool that can provide the length needed is returned. To use this, MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS also has to be enabled.
Warning: up to user to take care!: If you enable both MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS and MEM_USE_POOLS, you must have lwippools.h in your include path somewhere and you must define your pools within lwippools.h.
Dependency: Use MEM_USE_POOLS requires MEM_LIBC_MALLOC and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled and MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS=1

RefParameter.Name: MEM_USE_POOLS_TRY_BIGGER_POOL
RefParameter.Comment: MEM_USE_POOLS_TRY_BIGGER_POOL (Try Next Bigger Pool if Empty Malloc Pool)
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
When this option is enabled, if one malloc-pool is empty, the next bigger pool is tried.
Warning: Enabling this parameter might waste memory but it can make a system more reliable.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
Enable this options to include a user file lwippools.h that defines additional pools beyond the standard ones required by lwIP.
Warning: If you set this to 1, you must have lwippools.h in your include path somewhere and you must define your pools within lwippools.h.
Dependency: If MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS=0, MEM_USE_POOLS will be disabled and if MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS=1, MEM_USE_POOLS can be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ALLOW_MEM_FREE_FROM_OTHER_CONTEXT
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_ALLOW_MEM_FREE_FROM_OTHER_CONTEXT (Allow Memory Free From Other Context)
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description:
Enable this option if you want to free PBUF_RAM pbufs (or call mem_free()) from interrupt context (or another context that doesn't allow waiting for a semaphore).
If set to 1, mem_malloc will be protected by a semaphore and SYS_ARCH_PROTECT, while mem_free will only use SYS_ARCH_PROTECT. mem_malloc SYS_ARCH_UNPROTECTs with each loop so that mem_free can run.
Warning: As you can see from the above description, this leads to dis-/ enabling interrupts often, which can be slow! Also, on low memory, mem_malloc can need longer.
If you don't want that, at least for NO_SYS=0, you can still use the following functions to enqueue a deallocation call which then runs in the tcpip_thread context:
- pbuf_free_callback(p)
- mem_free_callback(m);.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_RAM_HEAP_POINTER
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description: If you want to relocate the heap to external memory, simply set a void-pointer to that location and make sure the memory at that location is big enough.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_RAM_HEAP_POINTER
RefParameter.Group: Infrastructure - Heap and Memory Pools Options
RefParameter.Description: If you want to relocate the heap to external memory, simply set a void-pointer to that location and make sure the memory at that location is big enough.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_PBUF
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_PBUF (Number of Memory Pool struct Pbufs)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of memp struct pbufs (used for PBUF_ROM and PBUF_REF). If the application sends a lot of data out of ROM (or other static memory), this should be set high.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB (Number of Raw Protocol Control Blocks)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of Raw connection PCBs (requires the LWIP_RAW option).
Dependency: Use MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB requires MEMP_MEM_MALLOC=0 and if LWIP_RAW=1, it is mandatory to have MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB>0.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN
RefParameter.Description:
Number of listening TCP connections (requires the LWIP_TCP option).
This corresponds to the maximum number of TCP ports which may be simultaneously listened on.
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_NETCONN is link to MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN value.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG (Number of TCP Segments simultaneously queued)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of simultaneously queued TCP segments (requires the LWIP_TCP option).
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG shuold be at least as big as TCP_SND_QUEUELEN when LWIP_TCP and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS are enabled and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1 to avoid Min value limitation.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_ALTCP_PCB
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_ALTCP_PCB (Number of simultaneously active ALTCP PCBs)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of simultaneously active altcp layer pcbs (requires the LWIP_ALTCP option).
Connections with multiple layers require more than one altcp_pcb (e.g. TLS over TCP requires 2 altcp_pcbs, one for TLS and one for TCP).

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_ALTCP_PCB
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_ALTCP_PCB (Number of simultaneously active ALTCP PCBs)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of simultaneously active altcp layer pcbs (requires the LWIP_ALTCP option).
Connections with multiple layers require more than one altcp_pcb (e.g. TLS over TCP requires 2 altcp_pcbs, one for TLS and one for TCP).
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_ALTCP_PCB requires LWIP_ALTCP.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA (Number of IP packets simultaneously queued for reassembly)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of IP packets simultaneously queued for reassembly (whole packets, not fragments!).
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA must be less than IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS when IP_REASSEMBLY is enabled and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_FRAG_PBUF
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_FRAG_PBUF (Number of IP Fragments simultaneously sent)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of IP fragments simultaneously sent (fragments, not whole packets!).
This is only used with LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF==0 and only has to be > 1 with DMA-enabled MACs where the packet is not yet sent when netif->output returns.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE (Number of simulateously queued Pbufs waiting for an ARP Request)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of simulateously queued outgoing packets (pbufs) that are waiting for an ARP request (to resolve their destination address) to finish (requires the ARP_QUEUEING option).
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE must be > 1 to use ARP_QUEUEING when LWIP_ARP is enabled and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP
RefParameter.Description:
Number of multicast groups whose network interfaces can be members at the same time: one per netif (allsystems group) plus one per netif membership. It requires the LWIP_IGMP option enabled.
Dependency: MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP must be greater than 1 if LWIP_IGMP option is enabled when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled.
Recommendation: This value must be at least twice the number of active network interfaces active in the configuration.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.DefaultValue: =LWIP_TCP + IP_REASSEMBLY + LWIP_ARP + (2*LWIP_DHCP) + LWIP_AUTOIP + LWIP_IGMP + LWIP_DNS + PPP_NUM_TIMEOUTS + (LWIP_IPV6 * (1 + LWIP_IPV6_REASS + LWIP_IPV6_MLD))
RefParameter.Min: =IF(!MEMP_MEM_MALLOC & LWIP_TIMERS, LWIP_TCP + IP_REASSEMBLY + LWIP_ARP + (2*LWIP_DHCP) + LWIP_AUTOIP + LWIP_IGMP + LWIP_DNS + PPP_NUM_TIMEOUTS + (LWIP_IPV6 * (1 + LWIP_IPV6_REASS + LWIP_IPV6_MLD)), 0)
RefParameter.Description:
The number of sys timeouts used by the core stack (not apps).
The default number of timeouts is calculated here for all enabled modules.
Dependency: If MEMP_MEM_MALLOC and LWIP_TIMERS are enabled, the MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT must have as minimum value: LWIP_TCP + IP_REASSEMBLY + LWIP_ARP + (2*LWIP_DHCP) + LWIP_AUTOIP + LWIP_IGMP + LWIP_DNS + PPP_NUM_TIMEOUTS + (LWIP_IPV6 * (1 + LWIP_IPV6_REASS + LWIP_IPV6_MLD)) (value expected for each parameter is either '0' or '1').

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_NETBUF
RefParameter.Description:
Number of netbuf structures which may be in use simultaneously (only needed if you use the sequential API like LWIP_NETCONN or LWIP_SOCKET).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_NETCONN
RefParameter.Description:
Number of struct netconns (only needed if you use the sequential API, like like LWIP_NETCONN or LWIP_SOCKET).
Dependency: There are 2 dependencies:
1) When LWIP_NETCONN is enabled, MEMP_MEM_MALLOC and LWIP_DISABLE_MEMP_SANITY_CHECKS are disabled, MEMP_NUM_NETCONN must not ecceed MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB + MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN + MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB + MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB
2) When LWIP_NETCONN, LWIP_SOCKET and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC are all enabled with LWIP_DISABLE_MEMP_SANITY_CHECKS disabled, MEMP_NUM_NETCONN cannot be 0.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_MEMP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_API
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_API (Number of TCPIP Message Structures Used for Callback)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of struct tcpip_msg, which are used for callback/timeout API communication (only needed if you use tcpip.c).
Dependency: Use MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_API requires MEMP_MEM_MALLOC disabled and LWIP_NETCONN or LWIP_SOCKET enabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_SELECT_CB
RefParameter.Description:
Number of struct lwip_select_cb (Only needed if you have LWIP_MPU_COMPATIBLE=1 and use the socket API. In that case, you need one per thread calling lwip_select.).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_INPKT
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_INPKT (Number of TCPIP Message Structures Used for Incoming Packets)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of struct tcpip_msg used for incoming packets (only needed if you use tcpip.c).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_NETDB
RefParameter.Description:
Number of concurrently running lwip_addrinfo() calls (before freeing the corresponding memory using lwip_freeaddrinfo()).
Dependency: Used if LWIP_DNS is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_LOCALHOSTLIST
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_LOCALHOSTLIST (Number of Host Entries in the Local Host List)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of host entries in the local host list if DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC=1.
Dependency: Used if LWIP_DNS is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_API_MSG
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_API_MSG (Number of Concurrent Active API Calls)
RefParameter.Description: Number of concurrently active calls to various socket, netconn, and tcpip functions.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_DNS_API_MSG
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_DNS_API_MSG (Number of Concurrent Active DNS Calls)
RefParameter.Description: Number of concurrently active calls to netconn_gethostbyname.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_SOCKET_SETGETSOCKOPT_DATA
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_SOCKET_SETGETSOCKOPT_DATA (Number of Concurrent Active Socket Calls)
RefParameter.Description: Number of concurrently active calls to getsockopt/setsockopt.

RefParameter.Name: MEMP_NUM_NETIFAPI_MSG
RefParameter.Comment: MEMP_NUM_NETIFAPI_MSG (Number of Concurrent Active Netif Calls)
RefParameter.Description: Number of concurrently active calls to netifapi functions.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_SUPPORT_CUSTOM_PBUF
RefParameter.Description: Custom Pbuf parameter.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_SUPPORT_CUSTOM_PBUF
RefParameter.Description: Custom Pbuf parameter.

RefParameter.Name: PBUF_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Comment: PBUF_POOL_SIZE (Number of Buffers in the Pbuf Pool)
RefParameter.Description: Number of buffers in the pbuf pool.

RefParameter.Name: PBUF_LINK_HLEN
RefParameter.Comment: PBUF_LINK_HLEN (Number of Bytes for Link Level Header)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of bytes that should be allocated for a link level header. The default is 14, the standard value for Ethernet.
Warning: To handle corner cases, PBUF_LINK_HLEN must be less than PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE - 40 (IP_HLEN + PBUF_TRANSPORT_HLEN) and greater or equal than 14.

RefParameter.Name: PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN
RefParameter.Comment: PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN (Number of Bytes for Link Encapsulation Level Header)
RefParameter.Description:
the number of bytes that should be allocated for an additional encapsulation header before ethernet headers (e.g. 802.11).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE
RefParameter.Comment: PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE (Size of each pbuf in the pbuf pool)
RefParameter.Min: =MAX(IF(!MEMP_MEM_MALLOC & PBUF_POOL_SIZE & LWIP_TCP & !LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS, PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN + PBUF_LINK_HLEN + PBUF_IP_HLEN + PBUF_TRANSPORT_HLEN + 1,0),MEM_ALIGNMENT)
RefParameter.Description:
Size of each pbuf in the pbuf pool.
The default is designed to accommodate single full size TCP frame in one pbuf, including TCP_MSS, IP header, and link header:
PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE default value is LWIP_MEM_ALIGN_SIZE(TCP_MSS+40+PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN+PBUF_LINK_HLEN)
Note: LWIP_MEM_ALIGN_SIZE(size) equals to: (size+MEM_ALIGNMENT-1U) & ~(MEM_ALIGNMENT-1U).
Warning: PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE should be greater or equal than PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN + PBUF_LINK_HLEN + PBUF_IP_HLEN + PBUF_TRANSPORT_HLEN if MEMP_MEM_MALLOC and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS are disabled and if LWIP_TCP and PBUF_POOL_SIZE are enabled, MEM_ALIGNMENT otherwise.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1 to keep only limitation on MEM_ALIGNMENT.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_PBUF_REF_T
RefParameter.Description:
Refcount type in pbuf. Default width of u8_t can be increased if 255 refs are not enough for you.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ARP
RefParameter.Description: Enable ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) functionality. When ARP is disabled, either PPP or SLIPIF should be enabled or user protocol interface should be added.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ARP
RefParameter.Description:
Enable ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) functionality. When ARP is disabled, either PPP or SLIPIF should be enabled or user protocol interface should be added.
Dependency: Use LWIP_ARP requires LWIP_ETHERNET.

RefParameter.Name: ARP_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Comment: ARP_TABLE_SIZE (Number of Active MAC-IP Address Pairs Cached)
RefParameter.Description:
Number of active MAC-IP address pairs cached.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: ARP_MAXAGE
RefParameter.Description:
The time an ARP entry stays valid after its last update, for ARP_TMR_INTERVAL = 1000, this is (60 * 5) seconds = 5 minutes.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: ARP_QUEUEING

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use ARP_QUEUEING requires MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC=0 and LWIP_ARP is enabled.

RefParameter.Description:
Multiple outgoing packets are queued during hardware address resolution.
By default, only the most recent packet is queued per IP address. This is sufficient for most protocols and mainly reduces TCP connection startup time.
Set this to 1 if you know your application sends more than one packet in a row to an IP address that is not in the ARP cache.

RefParameter.Name: ARP_QUEUEING
RefParameter.Description:
Multiple outgoing packets are queued during hardware address resolution.
By default, only the most recent packet is queued per IP address. This is sufficient for most protocols and mainly reduces TCP connection startup time.
Set this to 1 if you know your application sends more than one packet in a row to an IP address that is not in the ARP cache.
Dependency: Use ARP_QUEUEING requires MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC=0 and LWIP_ARP is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: ARP_QUEUE_LEN
RefParameter.Description:
The maximum number of packets which may be queued for each unresolved address by other network layers. Defaults to 3, 0 means disabled. Old packets are dropped, new packets are queued.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: ETHARP_SUPPORT_VLAN
RefParameter.Comment: ETHARP_SUPPORT_VLAN (Receiving Ethernet Packets with VLAN Header)
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, receiving and sending ethernet packets with VLAN header is supported. See the description of LWIP_HOOK_VLAN_CHECK and LWIP_HOOK_VLAN_SET hooks to check/set VLAN headers.
Additionally, you can define ETHARP_VLAN_CHECK to an u16_t VLAN ID to check.
If ETHARP_VLAN_CHECK is defined, only VLAN-traffic for this VLAN is accepted.
If ETHARP_VLAN_CHECK is not defined, all traffic is accepted.
Alternatively, define a function/define ETHARP_VLAN_CHECK_FN(eth_hdr, vlan) that returns 1 to accept a packet or 0 to drop a packet.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ETHERNET
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, ethernet is supported even though ARP might be disabled.
Warning: Ethernet needs to be kept activated to enable LwIP in STM32CubeMX.
Dependency: LWIP_ETHERNET needs to be turned on for LWIP_ARP.

RefParameter.Name: ETH_PAD_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Number of bytes added before the ethernet header to ensure alignment of payload after that header.
Since the header is 14 bytes long, without this padding e.g. addresses in the IP header will not be aligned on a 32-bit boundary, so setting this to 2 can speed up 32-bit-platforms.
Dependency: By default PBUF_LINK_HLEN value is set to ETH_PAD_SIZE+14.

RefParameter.Name: ETHARP_SUPPORT_STATIC_ENTRIES
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter enables code to support static ARP table entries (using etharp_add_static_entry/etharp_remove_static_entry).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: ETHARP_TABLE_MATCH_NETIF
RefParameter.Description:
Match netif for ARP table entries.
If disabled, duplicate IP address on multiple netifs are not supported (but this should only occur for AutoIP).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_IPV4
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter Enables IPv4 protocol.
Dependency: This parameter has dependencies with IP_FORWARD, IP_REASSEMBLY, IP_FRAG, LWIP_DHCP, LWIP_AUTOIP, LWIP_IGMP and LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS.

RefParameter.Name: IP_FORWARD
RefParameter.Comment: IP_FORWARD (Forward IP Packets Across Network Interfaces)

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: IP_FORWARD must be disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.

RefParameter.Description: This parameter enables the ability to forward IP packets across network interfaces. If you are going to run lwIP on a device with only one network interface, define this to 0.

RefParameter.Name: IP_FORWARD
RefParameter.Comment: IP_FORWARD (Forward IP Packets Across Network Interfaces)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter enables the ability to forward IP packets across network interfaces. If you are going to run lwIP on a device with only one network interface, define this to 0.
Dependency: IP_FORWARD is disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: IP_OPTIONS_ALLOWED
RefParameter.Description:
This option defines the behavior for IP options:
- IP_OPTIONS_ALLOWED=0: All packets with IP options are dropped.
- IP_OPTIONS_ALLOWED=1: IP options are allowed (but not parsed).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: IP_REASSEMBLY

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: IP_REASSEMBLY must be disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.
There are also some dependencies with MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA, IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS, MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, incoming fragmented IP packets are reassembled. Note that this option does not affect outgoing packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_FRAG.

RefParameter.Name: IP_REASSEMBLY
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, incoming fragmented IP packets are reassembled. Note that this option does not affect outgoing packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_FRAG.
Dependency: IP_REASSEMBLY is disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.
There are also some dependencies with MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA, IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS, MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT.

RefParameter.Name: IP_FRAG

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: IP_FRAG must be disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.
There is also some dependencies with LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, outgoing IP packets are fragmented if their size exceeds MTU. Note that this option does not affect incoming packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_REASSEMBLY.

RefParameter.Name: IP_FRAG
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, outgoing IP packets are fragmented if their size exceeds MTU. Note that this option does not affect incoming packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_REASSEMBLY.
Dependency: IP_FRAG must be disabled when LWIP_IPV4 is disabled.
There is also some dependencies with LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF.

RefParameter.Name: IP_REASS_MAXAGE
RefParameter.Comment: IP_REASS_MAXAGE (IP Packets Fragmentation if Size exceeds MTU)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum time (in multiples of IP_TMR_INTERVAL - so seconds, normally) a fragmented IP packet waits for all fragments to arrive. If not all fragments arrived in this time, the whole packet is discarded.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS
RefParameter.Comment: IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS (Maximum of Pbufs waiting to Be Reassembled)
RefParameter.Description:
Total maximum amount of pbufs waiting to be reassembled. Since the received pbufs are enqueued, be sure to configure PBUF_POOL_SIZE > IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS so that the stack is still able to receive packets even if the maximum amount of fragments is enqueued for reassembly!
When IPv4 *and* IPv6 are enabled, this even changes to (PBUF_POOL_SIZE > 2 * IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS)!
Dependency: Use IP_REASSEMBLY requires IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS>=MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: IP_DEFAULT_TTL
RefParameter.Description:
Default value for Time-To-Live used by transport layers.
This tells how long the packets may live on the network before they are dropped. Each time the packet passes a router, firewall, computer, i.e a node, the TTL is decremented with one step.
Setting the TTL to 255 would be considered rude since this would make a packet live an extremely long time on the internet.
Dependency: IP_DEFAULT_TTL is used to set by default: ICMP_TTL, RAW_TTL, UDP_TTL and TCP_TTL.

RefParameter.Name: IP_SOF_BROADCAST
RefParameter.Comment: IP_SOF_BROADCAST (Broadcast Filter per Pcb on UDP and Raw Send Operations)
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, the SOF_BROADCAST field is used to enable broadcast filter per pcb on udp and raw send operations. To enable broadcast filter on recv operations, you also have to set IP_SOF_BROADCAST_RECV=1.
Dependency: Use IP_SOF_BROADCAST_RECV requires IP_SOF_BROADCAST enabled.

RefParameter.Name: IP_SOF_BROADCAST_RECV
RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, broadcast filter on recv operations is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: IP_SOF_BROADCAST_RECV
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, broadcast filter on recv operations is enabled.
Dependency: Use IP_SOF_BROADCAST_RECV requires IP_SOF_BROADCAST enabled.

RefParameter.Name: IP_FORWARD_ALLOW_TX_ON_RX_NETIF
RefParameter.Comment: IP_FORWARD_ALLOW_TX_ON_RX_NETIF (IP Forward to send Packets back out on the NETIF)
RefParameter.Description:
Set this parameter allows ip_forward() to send packets back out on the netif where it was received. This should only be used for wireless networks.
Warning: When this is 1, make sure your netif driver correctly marks incoming link-layer-broadcast/multicast packets as such using the corresponding pbuf flags!
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: ICMP_TTL
RefParameter.Description:
Default value for Time-To-Live used by ICMP packets.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_BROADCAST_PING
RefParameter.Description:
Set this parameter allows responding to broadcast pings (default is unicast only).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_MULTICAST_PING
RefParameter.Description:
Set this parameter to allow responding to multicast pings (default is unicast only).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS requires LWIP_RAW and/or LWIP_UDP enabled.

RefParameter.Description: Set this parameter to allow multicast TX support like the socket options IP_MULTICAST_TTL/IP_MULTICAST_IF/IP_MULTICAST_LOOP, as well as (currently only) core support for the corresponding IPv6 options.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS
RefParameter.Description:
Set this parameter to allow multicast TX support like the socket options IP_MULTICAST_TTL/IP_MULTICAST_IF/IP_MULTICAST_LOOP, as well as (currently only) core support for the corresponding IPv6 options.
Dependency: Use LWIP_MULTICAST_TX_OPTIONS requires LWIP_RAW and/or LWIP_UDP enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_RAW

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_RAW requires MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled.

RefParameter.Description: If this parameter is enabled, the application layer to hook into the IP layer itself is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_RAW
RefParameter.Description:
If this parameter is enabled, the application layer to hook into the IP layer itself is enabled.
Dependency: Use LWIP_RAW requires MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB>0 when MEMP_MEM_MALLOC is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: RAW_TTL
RefParameter.Description:
Default value for Time-To-Live used by Raw packets.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK
RefParameter.Comment: DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK (DHCP with ARP Check on Offered Address)

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK requires LWIP_DHCP and LWIP_ARP both enabled.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, an ARP check on the offered address is done.

RefParameter.Name: DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, an ARP check on the offered address is done.
Dependency: Use DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK requires LWIP_DHCP and LWIP_ARP both enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_BOOTP_FILE

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP_BOOTP_FILE cannot be used with IPv6.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, offered_si_addr and boot_file_name are stored.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_BOOTP_FILE
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, offered_si_addr and boot_file_name are stored.
Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP_BOOTP_FILE cannot be used with IPv6.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_GET_NTP_SRV
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, request NTP servers with discover/select is performed. For each response packet, an callback is called, which has to be provided by the port: void dhcp_set_ntp_servers(u8_t num_ntp_servers, ip_addr_t* ntp_server_addrs).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_MAX_NTP_SERVERS
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_DHCP_MAX_NTP_SERVERS (Maximum Number of NTP Servers Requested)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter set the maximum of NTP servers requested.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_MAX_DNS_SERVERS
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_DHCP_MAX_DNS_SERVERS (Maximum Number of DNS Servers Requested)
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter set the maximum of DNS servers requested.
0: Request DNS servers with discover/select.
DNS servers received in the response are passed to DNS via @ref dns_setserver()
(up to the maximum limit defined here).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_AUTOIP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_AUTOIP requires LWIP_ARP and LWIP_IPV4 enabled.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, AUTOIP (AUTOmatic linklocal IP) module is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_AUTOIP
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, AUTOIP (AUTOmatic linklocal IP) module is enabled.
Dependency: Use LWIP_AUTOIP requires LWIP_ARP and LWIP_IPV4 enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_AUTOIP_COOP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP_AUTOIP_COOP requires LWIP_AUTOIP and LWIP_DHCP both enabled.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, it allows DHCP and AUTOIP to be both enabled on the same interface at the same time.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_AUTOIP_COOP
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it allows DHCP and AUTOIP to be both enabled on the same interface at the same time.
Dependency: Use LWIP_DHCP_AUTOIP_COOP requires LWIP_AUTOIP and LWIP_DHCP both enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DHCP_AUTOIP_COOP_TRIES
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter sets to the number of DHCP DISCOVER probes that should be sent before falling back on AUTOIP (the DHCP client keeps running in this case). This can be set as low as 1 to get an AutoIP address very quickly, but you should be prepared to handle a changing IP address when DHCP overrides AutoIP.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_MIB2_CALLBACKS
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, this turn on SNMP MIB2 callbacks.
Turn this on to get callbacks needed to implement MIB2.
Usually MIB2_STATS should be enabled, too.
Please read the snmp_agent.txt before turning on.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_TABLE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
DNS maximum number of entries to maintain locally.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_MAX_NAME_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description:
DNS maximum host name length supported in the name table.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_MAX_SERVERS
RefParameter.Description:
The maximum of DNS servers.
The first server can be initialized automatically by defining DNS_SERVER_ADDRESS(ipaddr), where ipaddr is an ip_addr_t*.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_MAX_RETRIES
RefParameter.Description:
DNS maximum number of retries when asking for a name, before timeout
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_DOES_NAME_CHECK
RefParameter.Description:
DNS do a name checking between the query and the response.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS_SECURE
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter controls the security level of the DNS implementation.
All DNS security features are used by default performed thanks to a logical OR: LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_XID | LWIP_DNS_SECURE_NO_MULTIPLE_OUTSTANDING | LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_SRC_PORT.
This is overridable but should only be needed by very small targets or when using against non standard DNS servers.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_XID
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter sets the DNS random security level.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS_SECURE_NO_MULTIPLE_OUTSTANDING
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter sets the DNS security level without multiple outstanding.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_SRC_PORT
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter sets the DNS security level with random source port.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST requires DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_INIT or DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC defined.

RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, a local host-to-address list is implemented.
If enabled, you have to define an initializer DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_INIT to {DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_ELEM("host_ip4", IPADDR4_INIT_BYTES(1,2,3,4)),DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_ELEM("host_ip6", IPADDR6_INIT_HOST(123, 234, 345, 456)}. This additional definition can be added inside a user section within lwipopts.h file
Instead, you can also use an external function: define DNS_LOOKUP_LOCAL_EXTERN(x) extern err_t my_lookup_function(const char *name, ip_addr_t *addr, u8_t dns_addrtype) that looks up the IP address and returns ERR_OK if found (LWIP_DNS_ADDRTYPE_xxx is passed in dns_addrtype).

RefParameter.Name: DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, a local host-to-address list is implemented.
If enabled, you have to define an initializer DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_INIT to {DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_ELEM("host_ip4", IPADDR4_INIT_BYTES(1,2,3,4)),DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_ELEM("host_ip6", IPADDR6_INIT_HOST(123, 234, 345, 456)}
Instead, you can also use an external function: define DNS_LOOKUP_LOCAL_EXTERN(x) extern u32_t my_lookup_function(const char *name) that returns the IP address or INADDR_NONE if not found.
Dependency: Use DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST requires DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_INIT or DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC defined.

RefParameter.Name: DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC
RefParameter.Description:
If this is turned on, the local host-list can be dynamically changed at runtime.
Dependency: Use DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST requires DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_INIT or DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC defined.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_DNS_SUPPORT_MDNS_QUERIES
RefParameter.Description:
Set this to 1 to enable querying ".local" names via mDNS using a One-Shot Multicast DNS Query.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_UDPLITE
RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, it turns on UDP-Lite (Requires LWIP_UDP).

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_UDPLITE
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, it turns on UDP-Lite (Requires LWIP_UDP).
Dependency: Use LWIP_UDPLITE requires LWIP_UDP enabled.

RefParameter.Name: UDP_TTL
RefParameter.Comment: UDP_TTL (Number of Time-To-Live Used by UDP Packets)
RefParameter.Description:
Default UDP Time-To-Live value.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETBUF_RECVINFO
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETBUF_RECVINFO (Append Destination and Port Addresses to every Netbuf)
RefParameter.Description:
Append destination addr and port to every netbuf.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_TTL
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_TTL (Number of Time-To-Live Used by TCP Packets)
RefParameter.Description:
Default TCP Time-To-Live value.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_WND
RefParameter.Description:
Size of a TCP window.
Warning: when using TCP_RCV_SCALE, TCP_WND is the total size with scaling applied. Maximum window value in the TCP header will be TCP_WND >> TCP_RCV_SCALE.
Dependency:
TCP_WND Min and Max values have some dependencies with other parameters (see init.c file for all details):
If you use TCP_WND with LWIP_TCP enabled:
- The minimum value advised by the stack is 2*TCP_MSS
- TCP_WND must fit in an u16_t or you have to enable window scaling
If you use TCP_WND with LWIP_TCP and LWIP_WND_SCALE enabled:
- TCP_WND must fit in an u32_t
- TCP_WND must be lower or equals than (0xFFFFU << TCP_RCV_SCALE)
If you use TCP_WND with LWIP_TCP enabled and MEMP_MEM_MALLOC and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS are disabled:- TCP_WND must be lower or equal than PBUF_POOL_SIZE*(PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE-(PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN + PBUF_LINK_HLEN + PBUF_IP_HLEN + PBUF_TRANSPORT_HLEN))
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_MAXRTX
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_MAXRTX (Maximum Number of Retransmissions of Data Segments)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of retransmissions of data segments.
Dependency: If LWIP_TCP=1, TCP_MAXRTX must less or equal to 12.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_SYNMAXRTX
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_SYNMAXRTX (Maximum Number of Retransmissions of SYN Segments)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of retransmissions of SYN segments.
Dependency: If LWIP_TCP=1, TCP_SYNMAXRTX must less or equal to 12.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ
RefParameter.Description:
If this parameter is enabled, TCP will queue segments that arrive out of order. Define to 0 if your device is low on memory.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: To use LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT, LWIP_TCP and TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ need to be enabled.

RefParameter.Description: If this parameter is enabled, TCP will support sending selective acknowledgements (SACKs).

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT
RefParameter.Description:
If this parameter is enabled, TCP will support sending selective acknowledgements (SACKs).
Dependency: To use LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT, LWIP_TCP and TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ need to be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP_MAX_SACK_NUM
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_TCP_MAX_SACK_NUM (Maximum Number of Sending Selective Acknowledgements)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of SACK values to include in TCP segments. Must be at least 1, but is only used if LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT is enabled.
NOTE: Even though we never send more than 3 or 4 SACK ranges in a single segment (depending on other options), setting this option to values greater than 4 is not pointless.
This is basically the max number of SACK ranges we want to keep track of. As new data is delivered, some of the SACK ranges may be removed or merged. In that case some of those older SACK ranges may be used again. The amount of memory used to store SACK ranges is LWIP_TCP_MAX_SACK_NUM * 8 bytes for each TCP PCB.
Dependency: LWIP_TCP_MAX_SACK_NUM must be greater than 0.
To use LWIP_TCP_MAX_SACK_NUM, LWIP_TCP_SACK_OUT and LWIP_TCP need to be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_MSS
RefParameter.Description:
TCP Maximum segment size. Default value is 536, this is a conservative value, you might want to increase this. For the receive side, this MSS is advertised to the remote side when opening a connection. For the transmit size, this MSS sets an upper limit on the MSS advertised by the remote host.
Warning: With Ethernet, the maximum size of a TCP segment allowed is 1460. To handle corner cases, the maximum value is also limited to: PBUF_POOL_SIZE / 2 * (PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE - (PBUF_LINK_HLEN + PBUF_IP_HLEN + PBUF_TRANSPORT_HLEN)).

RefParameter.Name: TCP_CALCULATE_EFF_SEND_MSS
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_CALCULATE_EFF_SEND_MSS (Checks TCP_MSS against NETIF MTU Used)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum size of a segment that TCP really sends, the 'effective send MSS,' MUST be the smaller of the send MSS (which reflects the available reassembly buffer size at the remote host) and the largest size permitted by the IP layer (RFC 1122) Setting this to 1 enables code that checks TCP_MSS against the MTU of the netif used for a connection and limits the MSS if it would be too big otherwise.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_SND_BUF
RefParameter.Description:
TCP sender buffer space (bytes). To achieve good performance.
Dependency: Use TCP_SND_BUF requires TCP enabled. When LWIP_TCP is enabled, TCP_SND_BUF must be at least as much as (2 * TCP_MSS) for things to work smoothly.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1 to avoid Min value limitation.
TCP_SND_BUF value is also used to set value of TCP_SND_QUEUELEN and TCP_SNDLOWAT.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_SND_QUEUELEN
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_SND_QUEUELEN (Number of Packet Buffers Allowed for TCP Sender)
RefParameter.Description:
TCP sender buffer space (pbufs).
Dependency: TCP_SND_QUEUELEN must be at least as much as (2*TCP_SND_BUF/TCP_MSS) if LWIP_TCP is enabled and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS disabled.
TCP_SND_QUEUELEN must be at least 2 for no-copy TCP writes to work, if LWIP_TCP is enabled.
TCP_SND_QUEUELEN must fit in an u16_t, if LWIP_TCP is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_SNDLOWAT
RefParameter.Description:
TCP writable space (bytes). This must be less than TCP_SND_BUF. It is the amount of space which must be available in the TCP snd_buf for select to return writable (combined with TCP_SNDQUEUELOWAT).
Dependency: TCP_SNDLOWAT is forced to be less than TCP_SND_BUF when LWIP_TCP is enabled and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS is disabled.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1 to disable the Max value limitation.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_SNDQUEUELOWAT
RefParameter.Description:
TCP writable bufs (pbuf count). This must be less than TCP_SND_QUEUELEN. If the number of pbufs queued on a pcb drops below this number, select returns writable (combined with TCP_SNDLOWAT).
Dependency: TCP_SNDQUEUELOWAT must be less than TCP_SND_QUEUELEN when LWIP_TCP is enabled and LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS is disabled.
If you know what you are doing, define LWIP_DISABLE_TCP_SANITY_CHECKS to 1 to disable the Max value limitation.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES (Maximum Number of Bytes Queued on ooseq per Pcb)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of bytes queued on ooseq per pcb if TCP_OOSEQ_BYTES_LIMIT is not defined. Default is 0 (no limit).. Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ=1.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_OOSEQ_BYTES_LIMIT(pcb)
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_OOSEQ_BYTES_LIMIT(pcb) (Maximum Number of Bytes Queued to be queued)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of bytes to be queued on ooseq per pcb, given the pcb. Use this to override TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES to a dynamic value per pcb.
Dependency: Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ=1 and TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES=1.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS (Maximum Number of Pbufs Queued on ooseq per Pcb)
RefParameter.Description:
Default maximum number of pbufs queued on ooseq per pcb if TCP_OOSEQ_BYTES_LIMIT is not defined. Default is 0 (no limit). Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ=1.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_OOSEQ_PBUFS_LIMIT(pcb)
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_OOSEQ_PBUFS_LIMIT(pcb) (Maximum Number of Pbufs Queued to be queued)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of pbufs to be queued on ooseq per pcb, given the pcb. Use this to override TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS to a dynamic value per pcb.
Dependency: Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ=1 and TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS=1.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: Use TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG requires LWIP_TCP, and TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG must be less than 256 and greater or equal than 0.

RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is enabled, the backlog option for tcp listen pcb is set.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, the backlog option for tcp listen pcb is set.
Dependency: Use TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG requires LWIP_TCP, and TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG must be less than 256 and greater or equal than 0.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG (Maximum Allowed Backlog for TCP Listen Netconns)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum allowed backlog for TCP listen netconns. This backlog is used unless another is explicitly specified. 0xff is the maximum (u8_t).
Dependency: Link with LWIP_TCP and TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG parameters: when LWIP_TCP and TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG are enabled, TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG must less than 256.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_OVERSIZE
RefParameter.Comment: TCP_OVERSIZE (Maximum Number of Bytes that tcp_write)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of bytes that tcp_write may allocate ahead of time in an attempt to create shorter pbuf chains for transmission. The meaningful range is 0 to TCP_MSS.
Some suggested values are:
- 0: Disable oversized allocation. Each tcp_write() allocates a new pbuf (old behaviour)
- 1: Allocate size-aligned pbufs with minimal excess. Use this if your scatter-gather DMA requires aligned fragments
- 128: Limit the pbuf/memory overhead to 20%
- TCP_MSS: Try to create unfragmented TCP packets
- TCP_MSS/4: Try to create 4 fragments or less per TCP packet.
Dependency: If TCP_OVERSIZE>0 LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF can be used.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP_TIMESTAMPS
RefParameter.Description:
Support the TCP timestamp option.
The timestamp option is currently only used to help remote hosts, it is not really used locally. Therefore, it is only enabled when a TS option is received in the initial SYN packet from a remote host.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_WND_UPDATE_THRESHOLD
RefParameter.Description:
Difference in window to trigger an explicit window update.
Dependency: TCP_WND_UPDATE_THRESHOLD is the min between (TCP_WND / 4) and (TCP_MSS * 4).

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_EVENT_API

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: One and exactly one of LWIP_EVENT_API and LWIP_CALLBACK_API has to be enabled when LWIP_TCP is enabled.

RefParameter.Description: LWIP_EVENT_API=1: The user defines lwip_tcp_event() to receive all events (accept, sent, etc) that happen in the system.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_EVENT_API
RefParameter.Description:
LWIP_EVENT_API=1: The user defines lwip_tcp_event() to receive all events (accept, sent, etc) that happen in the system.
Dependency: One and exactly one of LWIP_EVENT_API and LWIP_CALLBACK_API has to be enabled when LWIP_TCP is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_CALLBACK_API

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: One and exactly one of LWIP_EVENT_API and LWIP_CALLBACK_API has to be enabled when LWIP_TCP is enabled.

RefParameter.Description: LWIP_CALLBACK_API=1: The PCB callback function is called directly for the event. This is the default.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_CALLBACK_API
RefParameter.Description:
LWIP_CALLBACK_API=1: The PCB callback function is called directly for the event. This is the default.
Dependency: One and exactly one of LWIP_EVENT_API and LWIP_CALLBACK_API has to be enabled when LWIP_TCP is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_WND_SCALE
RefParameter.Description:
Set LWIP_WND_SCALE to 1 to enable window scaling.
When LWIP_WND_SCALE is enabled but TCP_RCV_SCALE is 0, we can use a large send window while having a small receive window only.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: TCP_RCV_SCALE
RefParameter.Description:
Set TCP_RCV_SCALE to the desired scaling factor, shift count in the range of 0..14.
When LWIP_WND_SCALE is enabled but TCP_RCV_SCALE is 0, we can use a large send window while having a small receive window only.
Dependency: If LWIP_TCP is enabled, maximum valid window scale value is 14.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_TCP_PCB_NUM_EXT_ARGS
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_TCP_PCB_NUM_EXT_ARGS (Number of Additional Argument Entries in an array)
RefParameter.Description:
When this is > 0, every tcp pcb (including listen pcb) includes a number of additional argument entries in an array (see tcp_ext_arg_alloc_id).
Dependency: None

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ALTCP

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: The application layered tcp API does not work with LWIP_EVENT_API.

RefParameter.Description:
Enable the altcp API. altcp is an abstraction layer that prevents applications linking against the tcp.h functions but provides the same functionality. It is used to e.g. add SSL/TLS or proxy-connect support to an application written for the tcp callback API without that application knowing the protocol details.
With LWIP_ALTCP=0, applications written against the altcp API can still be compiled but are directly linked against the tcp.h callback API and then cannot use layered protocols.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_ALTCP_TLS
RefParameter.Description:
Enable TLS support for altcp API. This needs a port of the functions in altcp_tls.h to a TLS library. A port to ARM mbedtls is provided with lwIP, see apps/altcp_tls/ directory and LWIP_ALTCP_TLS_MBEDTLS option.
Dependency: None

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_SINGLE_NETIF
RefParameter.Description:
This option uses use a single netif only. This is the common case for small real-life targets. Some code like routing etc. can be left out.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_HOSTNAME
RefParameter.Description:
This option uses DHCP_OPTION_HOSTNAME with netif's hostname field.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_API
RefParameter.Description: When this parameter is set, netif api is supported (in netifapi.c).

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_API
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is not set, netif api is not supported (in netifapi.c).
Dependency: Since NO_SYS=1, you cannot use NETIF API.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_STATUS_CALLBACK
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETIF_STATUS_CALLBACK (Callback Function on Interface Status Changes)
RefParameter.Description:
Set parameter allow to support a callback function whenever an interface changes its up/down status (i.e., due to DHCP IP acquisition).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_EXT_STATUS_CALLBACK
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETIF_EXT_STATUS_CALLBACK (Extended Callback Function for several netif)
RefParameter.Description:
Set parameter allow to support an extended callback function for several netif related event that supports multiple subscribers.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_LINK_CALLBACK
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETIF_LINK_CALLBACK (Callback Function on Interface Link Changes)
RefParameter.Description:
Set parameter allow to support a callback function from an interface whenever the link changes (i.e., link down).
Since CubeMx 6.0.0 release, It is enabled like in LwIP Cube FW applications.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_REMOVE_CALLBACK
RefParameter.Description:
Set parameter allow to support a callback function that is called when a netif has been removed.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_HWADDRHINT
RefParameter.Description:
Set parameter allow to support cache link-layer-address hints (e.g. table indices) in struct netif. TCP and UDP can make use of this to prevent scanning the ARP table for every sent packet. While this is faster for big ARP tables or many concurrent connections, it might be counterproductive if you have a tiny ARP table or if there never are concurrent connections.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF (Put Data into One Single Pbuf)
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, lwIP tries to put all data to be sent into one single pbuf. This is for compatibility with DMA-enabled MACs that do not support scatter-gather. Beware that this might involve CPU-memcpy before transmitting that would not be needed without this flag! Use this only if you need to!
Warning: a driver should NOT rely on getting single pbufs but check TX pbufs for being in one piece. If not, @ref pbuf_clone can be used to get a single pbuf.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF (Put Data into One Single Pbuf)
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, lwIP tries to put all data to be sent into one single pbuf. This is for compatibility with DMA-enabled MACs that do not support scatter-gather. Beware that this might involve CPU-memcpy before transmitting that would not be needed without this flag! Use this only if you need to!
Warning: a driver should NOT rely on getting single pbufs but check TX pbufs for being in one piece. If not, @ref pbuf_clone can be used to get a single pbuf.
Dependency: Use LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF requires TCP_OVERSIZE>0.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NUM_NETIF_CLIENT_DATA
RefParameter.Description:
Number of clients that may store data in client_data member array of struct netif (max. 256).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_HAVE_LOOPIF
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, LwIP supports loop interface (127.0.0.1). This is only needed when no real netifs are available. If at least one other netif is available, loopback traffic uses this netif.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_LOOPIF_MULTICAST
RefParameter.Description:
When this parameter is enabled, LwIP supports multicast/IGMP on loop interface (127.0.0.1).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK
RefParameter.Description:
Support sending packets with a destination IP address equal to the netif IP address, looping them back up the stack.
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_LOOPBACK_MAX_PBUFS
RefParameter.Comment: LWIP_LOOPBACK_MAX_PBUFS (Maximum Number of Pbufs for Loopback Sending)
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of pbufs on queue for loopback sending for each netif (0 = disabled).
Dependency: None.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING
RefParameter.Description:
This option indicates whether threading is enabled in the system, as netifs must change how they behave depending on this setting for the LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK option to work.
Setting this is needed to avoid reentering non-reentrant functions like tcp_input().
LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING=1: Indicates that the user is using a multithreaded environment like tcpip.c. In this case, netif->input() is called directly.
LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING=0: Indicates a polling (or NO_SYS=1) setup. The packets are put on a list and netif_poll() must be called in the main application loop.

RefParameter.Name: LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING
RefParameter.Description:
This option indicates whether threading is enabled in the system, as netifs must change how they behave depending on this setting for the LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK option to work.
Setting this is needed to avoid reentering non-reentrant functions like tcp_input().
LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING=1: Indicates that the user is using a multithreaded environment like tcpip.c. In this case, netif->input() is called directly.
LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING=0: Indicates a polling (or NO_SYS=1) setup. The packets are put on a list and netif_poll() must be called in the main application loop.
Dependency: LWIP_NETIF_LOOPBACK_MULTITHREADING is disabled when NO_SYS=1.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_NAME

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_NAME is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Description: Name assigned to the main tcpip thread.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_NAME
RefParameter.Description:
Name assigned to the main tcpip thread.
Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_NAME is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_STACKSIZE

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_STACKSIZE is used only if NO_SYS=0.
Default Preset: This parameter has been set with a non zero value to avoid functional issue with FREERTOS.
Up to user to fine tune this parameter value considering all dependencies.
Min value: The Min TCPIP Thread Stack Size value is the Min Stack Size of FREERTOS.
Max value: The Max TCPIP Thread Stack Size value is the Total Heap Size of FREERTOS divided by 4.

RefParameter.Description: Stack size used by the main tcpip thread (Word 32 bits). The stack size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_STACKSIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Stack size used by the main tcpip thread. The stack size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.
Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_STACKSIZE is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_PRIO

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_PRIO is used only if NO_SYS=0.
Default Preset: The default value is aligned on FreeRTOS default Task Priority.
Max value: The Max of TCPIP Thread Priority strictly less than the current FREERTOS MAX_PRIORITIES parameter.

RefParameter.Description: Priority assigned to the main tcpip thread. The priority value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_THREAD_PRIO
RefParameter.Description:
Priority assigned to the main tcpip thread. The priority value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.
Dependency: TCPIP_THREAD_PRIO is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_MBOX_SIZE

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: TCPIP_MBOX_SIZE is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Description:
Mailbox size for the tcpip thread messages. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when tcpip_init is called.
To be functional, the default value (0 in opt.h) is defined to 6 like in CubeMX Firmware packages LwIP examples.

RefParameter.Name: TCPIP_MBOX_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Mailbox size for the tcpip thread messages. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when tcpip_init is called.
Dependency: TCPIP_MBOX_SIZE is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Name: SLIPIF_THREAD_NAME

Condition.Diagnostic: Dependency: SLIPIF_THREAD_NAME is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Description: Name assigned to the slipif_loop thread.

RefParameter.Name: SLIPIF_THREAD_NAME
RefParameter.Description:
Name assigned to the slipif_loop thread.
Dependency: SLIPIF_THREAD_NAME is used only if NO_SYS=0.

RefParameter.Name: SLIPIF_THREAD_STACKSIZE

Condition.Diagnostic:
Dependency: SLIPIF_THREAD_STACKSIZE is used only if NO_SYS=0.
